Kernel Development

The kernel is the heart of the operating system. It is responsible for managing memory, processes, the file system, and hardware. Building a kernel from scratch is a challenging task, but it is highly educational and rewarding.

What to Implement:

  • Basic terminal (output to VGA)
  • Simple interrupt handling system (IDT)
  • Memory management (paging, heap, malloc)
  • Process management (scheduling, context switching)
  • File system and drivers

Kernels are typically written in C or Rust, with assembly used for low-level operations. Tools like QEMU can be used for testing without the need to install on real hardware.
